channel.title: R on R-Ladies #LdnOnt
channel.description: Recent content in R on R-Ladies #LdnOnt

item.title: Data Cleaning and Exploration
item.description: On Tuesday, December 3rd at 6 pm, the wonderful Jaky Kueper will be enlightening us on how to go on a data adventure. Jaky has taken us through a cleaning and exploration workshop before, and she‚Äôs awesome! Come and join us to learn some common practices and procedures for data cleaning and exploration ‚Äî how to get data into a ‚Äòusable‚Äô form and start looking at what they can tell you.

item.title: Fall 2019 - We're Back!
item.description: .col3 { columns: 2 100px; -webkit-columns: 2 100px; -moz-columns: 2 100px; } via GIPHY We‚Äôre back! Welcome back to another year of #RLadies #LdnOnt! This year we are starting out with three NEW organizers of R-Ladies London: Olivia, Caitlin and Daryn. A little bit about us: All three of us are 4th year combined speech-language pathology MClSc/PhD candidates (yes, we met through that!).

item.title: So long, farewell, and stay tuned!
item.description: via GIPHY Thus concludes this season of R-Ladies #LdnOnt! Thank you to Jaky for leading us through our last workshop together, and to all of you who came out to these things over the last two and a half years. Workshop materials are posted in the usual places (website, GitHub, Drive). Some news that I‚Äôve spoken about a bit in person but not in any official capacity yet: Sally and I are stepping down as organizers.

item.title: Upcoming workshop: Heatmaps and Pointmaps using ggmap
item.description: R enthusiasts, bike enthusiasts, map enthusiasts alike, come play! Quick deets! ‚ùì What is R-Ladies? A low-key get together for people interested in using and learning more about R, a powerful statistical software program. We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Thursday, March 28, 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Lawson Room on the first floor, across from the main library entrance (formerly known as the Richmond Room).

item.title: SPSS 2 R: Materials
item.description: See you next year, R-Ladies! And thus concludes our final R-Ladies #LdnOnt event of 2018! Thanks to Daryn for leading our last workshop of the season, Transitioning from SPSS to R, version 2.0. We were a smaller crowd this time (that‚Äôs the end of the academic term, for you), but I think these are a great set of resources to have. SPSS 2 R: Two for the price of one!

item.title: Upcoming workshop: Transitioning from SPSS to R
item.description: Quick deets! ‚ùì What is R-Ladies? A low-key get together for people interested in using and learning more about R, a powerful statistical software program. We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Thursday, November 29, 6:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Richmond Room on the first floor, across from the main library entrance.

item.title: Figuring out figures in R using ggplot: Workshop materials
item.description: Thanks to all who came out for our October meet up! You can find the code we used for the figures, along with the data and the source code used to make the presentation at our Github or on our Google Drive. The slides presented at the workshop are below (or, if you‚Äôd like a larger version, here)
